Summary •	10 years hands-on Oracle Apps Technical Experience in Oracle EBS R12/11i Applications environment. 
•	Experience working in agile development environments and Scrum methodologies. 
•	Experience in Implementation and Upgrade of Oracle Apps R12 for Oracle P2P (Procure to Pay) and OTC (Order to Cash) business process. 
•	Strong understanding of Business flows, underlying technical architecture and table structure of Oracle E-Business Financials (AP, AR and GL), Supply Chain (PO), Order Management (OM, TCA), Manufacturing (WIP, BOM), Inventory (INV) and CRM Suite (SC, IB). 
•	Experience in Development of RICEFW Components using development tools such as (Oracle Developer (Forms 6i/9i and Reports 6i/9i), Workflow Builder, XML Publisher, Oracle Application Framework (OAF). 
•	Experienced in providing Tier 1 and 2 Support for Rolled out projects, Month end close activities and Quarter release/Monthly releases. 
•	Experience in Building & Supporting Form Customizations (Custom PLL Customization & Zoom functionality) and Extensions (Process Constraint) on all the functions built on top of Oracle EBS platform. 
•	Experience in Converting business solution into technical design document based on functional specification complying with Oracle AIM standards. 
•	Experienced in Integration of SOA application with EBS application and Working knowledge of BPEL. 
•	Experience in Customizing Oracle Workflows & building customization using Oracle Applications Framework (OAF). 
•	Experience in Enterprise Job Scheduling tool Control M used to schedule jobs in EBS and other critical Enterprise Application integration interfaces. 
•	Experience in Performance Tuning & UNIX Shell Scripting. 
•	Experienced in working with Version control and software configuration management tools including Perforce/CVS and HP project and portfolio management (PPM). 
•	Exposure to Java 7 programming. 
•	Working knowledge of Tableau BI Tool.

 Experience Senior Oracle Application Developer Symantec April 2015  – Present (4 months) Mountain View , CA Working as Oracle Apps Technical Consultant in Implementation Team for Oracle apps R12 for modules like OM, AR, AP, PO, INV, SCM, Service Contracts, Install Base and GL.  
Role & Responsibilities: 
	Involved in design, development and testing of Interfaces using PL/SQL to interface non- oracle and Oracle systems to Oracle applications Modules OM, SCM, INV, Service Contracts, Install Base modules. 
	Involved in Integration of Oracle Renewals Notification with Eloqua and Other External Partner System. 
	Involved in development of logic to Pre - Validate legacy data for Order management and Oracle Service Contracts. 
	Involved in development of logic to create Oracle Order using oracle standard API’s. 
	Involved in development of logic to apply Holds on Order using oracle standard API’s. 
	Involved in development of logic to show Errored records in Error Correction Form and allow user to update only specific fields using Form Personalization. 
	Involved in Integration of Oracle BMI (Big Machines) and Oracle ERP for Product and Price publication using SFTP. 
	Involved in development of logic to create Usage line for subscription service contract and attach usage counter and Modifier to Usage line for Subscription service contract. 
	Involved in development of logic to create Contract Billing schedule. 
	Involved in Development Technical specifications document to address new business requirements and involved in impact analysis when delivered object is customized. 
	Involved in Conducting Code Review for the Fit Gap done by the Dev team members. 
 Senior Oracle Apps Technical Consultant VMware April 2014  –  April 2015  (1 year 1 month) palo alto,ca -	Working with Functional Oracle EBS Team Members (BA) to gather requirement and to troubleshoot reported OTC/SDP related production defects pertaining to Oracle ERP applications. 
-	Managing the Order to Cash process end to end i.e. Gathering requirements, create design documents, perform configurations and coding, perform unit testing and post go live support. 
-	Managing offshore team and Coordinating for Production issue on daily basis and conducting daily Status Call for the Test instance Defects. 
-	Experience in SFDC (Sales Force) to create reports and pulling out Data for Defects/Change Requests (CR). 
-	Providing tier 1 and 2 support for production issues including month end (after hours and weekend on call) and parallel Quarter release/Monthly releases from Dev->Test->UAT->LT->Prod->Smoke Test->Go live. 
-	Develop Technical specifications document to address new OTC/SDP related business requirements and involved in impact analysis when delivered object is customized. 
-	Provide Technical/Functional support during the implementation of new OTC/SDP features and SDP Tenants as needed. 
-	Conduct Code Review for the Fit Gap done by the Dev team members. 
-	Helping Dev team members to resolve technical issues and training new team members. 
-	Helping QA to create valid Use cases for Testing new OTC/SDP related business requirements. 
Control M EBS integration  
Responsibilities : 
•	Migrate EBS Scheduled Sysadmin jobs to Control M  
•	Migrate EBS Scheduled Vmadmin jobs to Control M  
•	Identify cross functional jobs critical to month end, quarter end and year end and migrate to Control M 
•	Configure and automate workload, job flow, and cross application inter-dependencies to manage SLA and to be Sox compliant.

To view their license keys and perform operations like split/merge on portal

View Senior Software Engineer - Oracle Apps Google June 2013  –  March 2014  (10 months) mountain view,ca Client Name : Google, Mountain View, CA 
Employer : Wipro Ltd 
Oracle Apps Environment : 11.5.10 
Modules : Oracle Order Management,Oracle Inventory,Oracle Purchasing,SOA,BPEL 
The Google Android Bizapps project involves Go-live of Android Phone on various countries and SOA/B2B integration of all the Vendors and Logistics Partner with Google's EBS application. This integration consists of receiving and sending the B2B messages in both the formats (RosettaNet, EDI) and transforming them to Google's created Canonical and route them to the Oracle EBS application after validating the messages for functional requirement. 
 
•	Development of logic to validate business validations to Integrate SOA and Oracle using PL/SQL. 
•	Improving Performance of PL/SQL logics using Oracle Indexing, Histogram on table etc. 
•	Development of Outbound interface to send data to SOA to update inventory.  
•	Configuration of setups required to go live Android phone on various countries. 
•	Designed Common Error handling framework to log & debug error. 
•	Participated in code reviews and design discussions.  
•	Performed unit testing and involved in integration testing and production support of various Inbound & Outbound transactions for Android. 
•	Working with partners to finalize the mapping document which partners will be communicating the xml files 
•	Designing the b2b and SOA network adaptors to flow the data through web services 
•	End to end design testing with valid data in UAT 
•	Worked with Google partner to generate a standard template for any future integration. 
•	Worked extensively on AP, PO, iProcurement and iExpense modules. 
•	Worked on customizing iProcurement Requisition and Receiving pages. 
•	Customized iProcurement Requisition OA pages such as Requisition Home page, Requisition Search page (ExpSearchPG.xml). Customized different regions in Home page and Search page. 
•	Personalized iProcurement Preferences page, Requisition Summary display page and Requisition Checkout page.

http://money.cnn.com/2014/12/23/technology/google-lyrics/index.html Staff Software Engineer Google November 2012  –  May 2015  (2 years 7 months) Technical lead Google October 2005  –  October 2012  (7 years 1 month) Contributed to multiple engineering teams improving Google Search, usually as the technical lead. 
 
Knowledge Graph: 
Currently lead a team that developed a major portion of the Knowledge Graph, one of the most significant improvements to Google Search in the company's history. Searches for many kinds of entities -- such as a person, movie, book, or city -- now display information on the right side of the page describing that entity and other relevant entities. My team identifies the most relevant entities to show. For example, after a search for an actor, we determine the actor's most significant movies and other people the user may be interested in. For more information, see http://googleblog.blogspot.com/2012/05/introducing-knowledge-graph-things-not.html 
 
Universal Search: 
Improved Universal Search, which combines different kinds of search results (images, maps, video, etc.) with web results on the www.google.com search results page. Led a team that generated signals indicating which universal corpora should be displayed in what positions for a given query. Also wrote a powerful framework, part of the infrastructure that runs during every search, that implements complex policies to merge different kinds of universal results into a coherent and renderable page of search results. 
 
Search evaluation: 
Led a team that gathered, aggregated, scored, and analyzed multiple kinds of search results. Those search results provided data that is needed for monitoring, tuning, and making launch decisions, all essential steps for improving Google's search quality. 
 
Java Libraries: 
Implemented many Java collection classes, such as a powerful Multimap, and other Java library classes. Those Java libraries significantly improve the productivity of Java developers throughout Google and in the broader Java community who depend on the highly regarded Guava library at http://code.google.com/p/guava-libraries/ Senior software developer PassMark Security August 2005  –  October 2005  (3 months) Knowledge transfer of Vocent technology 
Integration of Vocent & PassMark software. Speech application developer Vocent Solutions, Inc. April 2001  –  August 2005  (4 years 5 months) As one of the first two developers at Vocent, created a substantial portion of Vocent's Password Reset speech authentication application, which we successfully deployed at 18 customer sites. Single-handedly integrated with a wide variety of speech platforms. Wrote a highly configurable application engine that managed all aspects of the dialog flow, such as playing correct prompts and generating recognition grammars. 
 
Routinely completed primary programming tasks ahead of schedule, allowing me to take on additional responsibilities. Designed dialog specifications, including exact phrasing of prompts. Combined software components from all Vocent developers into a solid, thoroughly tested, well-documented product. Wrote highly-used reference manuals describing how to install and configure the software. Fixed subtle race conditions in a complex multi-threaded proprietary C++ speech platform. Served on the Vocent software architecture committee. Senior software developer TenFold June 1995  –  March 2001  (5 years 10 months) Implemented several software components, including database import, database export, and release management utilities. Designed database tables, built graphical user interfaces, and wrote C code. Provided technical leadership to a rapidly growing twelve-person team and managed two team members. Administered the company-wide release process. Prepared three half-day courses and taught those courses to hundreds of customers and coworkers. Experience Senior Software Engineer Google April 2015  – Present (4 months) Greater Chicago Area Senior Software Engineer Google December 2014  –  April 2015  (5 months) Greater New York City Area Continuing to work on Google Apps Script, I became tech lead of the product's backend, leading the team through its largest and most complex product launch to date: add-ons for Google Docs and Google Sheets. 
 
I worked closely with fellow engineers as well as the product management and developer relations organizations to support and improve the existing Apps Script product while brainstorming and helping bring to fruition new features to allow developers to extend Google Apps in new, powerful ways. Software Engineer Google June 2012  –  November 2014  (2 years 6 months) Greater New York City Area After graduating college, I returned to Google as a full-time employee. As during my internship, I'm working on the Google Apps Script team. Developing and maintaining a JavaScript platform allowing consumer and corporate users to access Google services, Apps Script puts users in control of their information and allows easy automation of common business tasks. 
 
Initially, I worked to improve the autocomplete and documentation infrastructure I implemented during my internship, as well as fixing various bugs and implementing new features in Apps Script's JavaScript runtime, helping widen the team's automated testing coverage, and committing miscellaneous bug fixes and new features. Software Engineering Intern Google June 2011  –  September 2011  (4 months) Greater New York City Area The summer before my senior year of college I interned at Google, working on Google Apps Script, a cloud-based JavaScript platform targeting Google Docs and Apps services. I implemented improvements for the script editor's autocomplete implementation, in addition to making bug fixes to various other parts of the project. 
 
My work consisted primarily of backend changes; however, I also made some minor improvements to the frontend. I spent most of my time programming in Java; additionally, I reported two security holes in a Python-based internal Web application. Co-Op Developer in DIS Division Argonne National Laboratory June 2010  –  September 2010  (4 months) Greater Chicago Area I added new, user-visible features to an in-house charting library, investigated ORM tools for a new project, and documented some existing database access code (JDBC for the frontend and Oracle Pro*C for the backend). Furthermore, I learned basic UML, using diagrams to expose intricate details of excessively complex systems. 
 
During my Argonne internship, I gained experience with Oracle and enterprise Java while learning some of the challenges surrounding legacy C code maintenance. I also alerted the full-time staff to a possible license violation regarding an open source CSV parsing library, suggesting possible licensing options and alternative libraries. Web Application Developer North Central College September 2009  –  March 2010  (7 months) Greater Chicago Area While studying at North Central College, I worked part time for several months at their Information Technology Services department, collaborating with full-time Web development staff to completely rewrite the school's online event calendar. The new Web calendar was implemented in PHP with a MySQL backend, making heavy use of the Zend Framework and jQuery libraries to speed development and provide a fluid, intuitive user experience. 
 
Highlights of the new calendar included better support for organizing events, a timeline visualization for the room scheduler, and improved security due to use of the school's Novell LDAP server to authenticate calendar users.
